lead_paragraph: SHERWOOD--Frances (Fran) Jane, lived and loved with chutzpah, from August 16, 1944 - March 6, 2016, and died peacefully in her home at the age of 71, after a brave battle with cancer. She expressed her love and characteristic generosity, while maintaining a brilliant sense of humor until the very end. She is survived by adoring friends and relatives, including daughters Lauren and Karen, life partner Denis, grandchildren Hannah, Amelia, Asa and Lily, sister Doris, niece Joanna, aunt Flossy, and cousins Nancy and Jane. Fran was born of parents Ruth and Joseph in New York City and was raised in the Philadelphia area, before returning to NYC to raise her own children. Fran was a passionate foodie and chef, trained at Le Cordon Bleu in Paris. She was a world traveler, sun-worshipper, expert shopper, disco queen, and warm- hearted friend to all. She was known as the "Ultimate Fun Mom" and "Life of The Party," by all those who had the pleasure and joy of knowing her. Please raise your glasses ("It's five o'clock somewhere!") and give a toast to Fran, who will forever remind us to live life to the fullest. We will miss you and love you always... xoxo. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SHERWOOD, FRANCES (FRAN) JANE
